intro: Phragmanthera lapathifolia, commonly known as the common phragmanthera, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and along stream banks. Its botanical characteristics make it a valuable plant for ecological studies and traditional herbal medicine.
